@sryza doesn't seem to merge correctly. Mind up-merging it?
@MLnick hey Nick, are you planning on implementing the reverse direction - `saveAsSequenceFile` and `saveAsHadoopFile`? If not, I'd like to give it a shot.
@pwendell the failure doesn't seem to be related to this patch. Could we re-test?
Thanks - I'll merge this into 1.1 and 1.0.1

Hey Vadim - thanks for this fix! I'll defer to @tdas on the optimal architecture of the fix, but this one seems good to me. 

We usually ask that people submit fixes against master and then, when merging the fix, we'll back port it into one or more maintenance branches. The easiest way to do this might be for you to just open a new pull request against master (it's only a one line change).
Thanks for the explanation @mridulm , really appreciate it.
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/15661/
Jenkins, test this please. LGTM - good catch on this, thanks for the fix!
Hey @lallea mind quickly creating a JIRA for this? We try to do this with any user-facing bug so if someone runs into it they can quickly figure out which version it is fixed in.
Refer to this link for build results: https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/15660/

Do you mind running pep8 on this? Let's make sure that doesn't report any style violations. 

We will get pep8 integrated with Jenkins in the future.
Ah, I see. :) Thank you for the gentle pointer. I've fixed 2 PEP8 violations in my patch, as well as 1 PEP8 violation elsewhere.
@sryza looks like the python tests are failing
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Thanks. I am merging this in master.
@Qiuzhuang  Why have a lot of non-relevant changes?

Just curious -- will this patch change how users specify paths to native libraries on the worker machines? (I think the current way is to set `spark.executor.extraLibraryPath` in e.g. spark-defaults.conf.)

Sorry, my repo looks messed. I am closing PR.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
